FuncDef: The arp gratuitous-arp send enable command enables an interface to periodically send gratuitous Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) packets. The undo arp gratuitous-arp send enable command restores the default configuration. By default, the function of periodically sending gratuitous ARP packets on an interface is not enabled or disabled. Instead, the global configuration policy is used.

ExtraInfo: If an attacker counterfeits a gateway and sends users a forged ARP packet, these user terminals will record incorrect ARP entries and cannot send data to the correct gateway. To prevent this problem, run the arp gratuitous-arp send enable command to enable the gateway's interface to periodically send gratuitous ARP packets, thereby updating authorized users' ARP entries to be correct.
